companies.name: Bantam Planet
companies.description: Bantam Planet is a North American game publisher established on June 25th, 2020. The company was founded by Ike Brunicardi as Creator, World Builder, and Game Director, and Max Palmer as Conductor and Director of Business and Growth. Based in the U.S. and aiming to distribute worldwide, Bantam Planet is showcasing its first game: Bantam West.Bantam West introduces the planet Bantam, a diminutive world whose resilient inhabitants are fierce and seasoned fighters. Home to many different biomes and cultures, Bantam is brimming with cowboys and cultists, merchants and mobsters, politicians, soldiers, and even mythological beasts. Players and fans will explore new environments and territories with each game in the Bantam Series, revealing undiscovered enemies and lore.Mission Statement: Our mission is to provide you with an unforgettable tabletop experience. We aim to create games that build rich narratives, bring joy to players, and provide challenging puzzles. Our three pillars for creation are rock-solid mechanics, an expansive theme in both breadth and depth and gorgeous artwork. While the complexity and detail conveyed by our games might not suit everyone's interests, we strive to create an all-inclusive world. Bantam is a world wherein anyone can be a hero regardless of race, color, gender, religion, age, disability, or national origin."Bantam Planet... Wish You Were Here!"

companies.name: BoardGameGeek
companies.description: What is BoardGameGeek?BoardGameGeek is an online resource and community that aims to be the definitive source for board game and card game content. The site is updated on a real-time basis by its large and still growing user base â more than three million registered users! â making the Geek the largest and most up-to-date place to get gaming information! You can become a registered member of BGG for free, although we welcome your contributions to the site in the form of ratings, reviews, and thoughts on games to the existing database!BGG features reviews, ratings, images, play-aids, translations, and session reports from board game geeks around the world, as well as live discussion forums. In addition, every day nearly a hundred game trades pass through the hands of registered members, as well as transactions in the Geek Market. If you are new to the site and are wondering where to begin, you might start with the Guide to BoardGameGeek.What is the BoardGameGeek Store?As the largest and most comprehensive website supporting the board gaming hobby, we have relationships with most publishers in the business, and these publishers often produce various goodies for their games. Most of these promos were originally offered as preorder bonuses, or were made available at a convention of some sort. If you weren't able to get to show or special event, you may be able to get them at the BGG Store.We also specialize in contracts with publishers to use their game art to make exclusive game upgrade products under our GeekUp line, including bits, bags, boxes, and stunning wall art inspired by games.Finally, we also sell various BoardGameGeek merchandise such as t-shirts, mugs, and other household items so fans of the site can get in on some BoardGameGeek swag!

companies.name: Dominate&Delegate - the Command&Conquer boardgame
companies.description: Thomas Denkmeier (Austria)What makes D&D special:Dominate & Delegate is inspired by Command & Conquer. A game I played back in the 90s and still play passionately on the PC. Surprisingly, it is the first implementation of the PC game. Of course, according to the agreement with EA Inc, I had to change all forms, pictures, logos and names. My board game is not designed for a large mass of customers to generate high profits. Like many of my projects (e.g. "Katakis" music video, "Die MaschinenstÃ¼rmer"-LARP and my carnival costumes and parades) D&D is a pure fan project to realize myself and to share my enthusiasm with like-minded people. Even as a child I felt the urge to share enthusiasms. A good example: I remember that at that time it was impossible for me to watch the first time "Star Wars" all alone. On the other hand, I always felt the urge to imitate something I was enthusiastic about. In my childhood these were the following examples: Building Star Wars spaceships with LEGO. My carnival costume at the age of 12 as "Boush". And the 2 arcade games "1943" and "Thunder Cross" using the gamemaker SEUCK on the C64 and Amiga.Dominate & Delegate is designed as a 0-business. So, my goal is to share my passion as much as possible and not to make any financial losses.Characteristics regarding the game mechanics:Reviewers reported that the game rules are designed to reflect the video game as best as possible. As a result, the rules are coherent and easy to remember, even though they are a relatively large amount of textual material.In a skirmish (a symmetrical battle 1-3PL), there is no typical strategic recipe to win. Rather, it doesn't matter what kind of strategy you choose, each is threatening to your opponent and could lead to victory.The battle system, while very tactical, is quick to play. There is also no activation token / health point fiddling around. This has the advantage, if in large-scale battles many figures are set up or 4 players exist, each of the players does not have to wait long until it is his turn again.The content of the box is extremely extensive. It consists of 272 plastic faction figures in 4 different colors. There are many modular base plates for outdoor and indoor setups in addition to the large 560 x 560 game board.Extensive 2PL campaign with 39 missions, many ramifications, many secrets and high replay value.Special 1PL Camapign.Extensive tactical options and mechanics: pinch tactics, resource mining, base building, secret production, stealth units, artillery, air units, transport units, super weapon, water units, reward cards, energy management, infiltrators/Capturers, Fog of War, bridges, walls and civilian buildings.Both outdoor missions and indoor missions.

companies.name: Fitz&Pop's Tabletops
companies.description: At Fitz&Pops Tabletops, we don't just roll the dice on ordinaryâwe're board with boring! We're committed to crafting games that break the mold with wild themes, engaging stories, and clever mechanics that'll keep you guessing.Our games are packed with humor and quirky characters that'll have you laughing while you strategize. Don't let the fun looks fool youâour games may make you chuckle, but they'll also make you think!We believe the best games combine accessible fun with surprising depth, creating experiences that are easy to enjoy but challenging to master. Why play it safe when you can play it spectacular?Stefano VirgilliMeet Your Board Game Mechanisms MixologistMeet Stefano, who blends board game mechanisms like a master bartender crafts cocktails. Give him any combination of mechanicsâworker placement, engine building, area controlâand he'll shake them up into something surprisingly fresh and entertaining. What sets him apart is speed: he can rapidly prototype game concepts, finding that sweet spot where different systems create satisfying "aha!" moments that keep players coming back for more.Ernestas JasillonisWho Needs AI When You Have This Guy?Meet Ernestas, our art director who proves that human creativity still reigns supreme. While the world rushes toward automated everything, Ernestas takes the opposite approachâevery single illustration is meticulously crafted through his hands-on art direction and artistic execution. No algorithms, no shortcuts, just pure creative vision and genuine human artistry at its finest.

companies.name: Lonny Games
companies.description: Lonny Games is a specialized board game publisher based in Austria, focusing exclusively on the development, production, and distribution of 18xx games â a niche within the board gaming world aimed at experienced players. The name goes back to founder and designer Leonhard "Lonny" Orgler, who is internationally renowned for his innovative and well-crafted 18xx designs.Focus and Philosophy:The companyâs philosophy is to combine deep strategic decision-making, economic simulation, and historically inspired railway networks in its games. Each title pays homage to Francis Treshamâs classic 1830 system, while expanding on its foundation with original mechanisms, new challenges, and often regional-historical themes.The games are typically produced in small print runs, making them especially popular among collectors and 18xx enthusiasts worldwide.Target Audience:Lonny Games caters to a dedicated community of heavy gamers who value economic depth, long-term planning, and competitive interaction. The games are not designed for casual players, but for groups who enjoy engaging with a single game over several hoursâor even days.Distinctive Features:Own online shopRegular updates and variants for existing titlesClose collaboration with the 18xx community (e.g., via BGG, conventions, Discord)High standards of quality in components and layoutConclusion:Lonny Games stands for expert-level board games created with passion by one of the most prominent designers in the 18xx genre. For those who love complex economic systems, tactical stock manipulation, and the construction of historical railway networks, these games offer depth, challengeâand personality.

TOSSIT is also widely used in schools, therapy, and senior centers as an engaging tool for learning and motor skills training.Made in Europe from 100% food-grade, dishwasher-safe silicone, TOSSIT stands for quality, sustainability, and innovation. They embody our philosophy: design that meets functionality and sustainability. companies.name: Tabletop R&D
companies.description: Tabletop R&D is a company that offers game designers automatic testing services, via the creation of digital versions of tabletop games. We automatically play games thousands of times and extract in-depth gameplay statistics, to answer broad or specific design questions (such as balanced board setups, winning conditions triggering most/least, the estimated power of individual cards etc.). As a supplemental tool for the game development process, we hope to help developers find solid designs that meet their expectations, so human playtesting time can be used most efficiently to determine subjective aspects such as look and feel, fun and engagement.

companies.description: The Game Builders are a publisher and an open development studio for creating board games, known for games like Applejack, Planta Nubo and Suna Valo. It is our goal to help realize challenging and exciting board games. For this we combine our passion in gaming and professionality in design and development. In short: we love well-made board games!

companies.name: The Spiel Foundation
companies.description: The Spiel Foundation is a international charity focused play as a positive and powerful force in the world. All of our many efforts are driven by this beautiful idea - the more we play together, the better and more compassionate the world can be. We deliver tens of thousands of board games to organizations in need across the world (libraries, hospitals, senior homes, community centers, homeless shelters, domestic violence shelters, boys & girls clubs, schools, mental health facilities, and even prisons). We have delivered over 18,000 games in recent years and have another 20,000 games being readied for delivery.We oversee two game award programs: Major Fun and The Spiel of Approval. Major Fun celebrates games great for kids, families and parties. The Spiel of Approval celebrates games that encourage thoughtful or strategic play. Our media network includes The Spiel podcast, a show that has been in production for 19 years, covering the world of games and the people who love them. We also produce documentary films like Made for Play: Board Games & Modern Industry.We rent booth space big game conventions so  we can host game demo tables for a wide array of international publishers and designers who might not be able to afford their own exhibit space.We will be opening our own facility, the DeKoven Center for Play in Indianapolis in 2026! It is a hub for all our activities. It will have greatly expanded storage space for our bundle program. It will also have a large game library and sommunity space for regular game sessions as well as events and seminars. Everything we do, we try to make the world just a little more playful. We hope you will come visit our booth, demo some games, donate a little money to play in our Spielathon, and (most importantly) HAVE FUN!
